history.content:
I took the class last summer and it was not webcasted. Discussions were not mandatory, but you had to attend lab at least once a week because we had a check-off system. You'd have to explain your thought process behind a lab or homework question to a lab assistant to get checked off, and if you didn't you would get -1 point for the week. I do know people who had conflicts and made special arrangements with the instructor to get checked off at a time that worked for them. Not sure if the same system will continue this summer.

Hope that helps!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I also took the class last summer. It was not webcasted. However, I went to all the lectures because the instructors (Marvin Zhang - now a Berkeley PhD student and Brian Hou - now a CMU PhD student) were absolutely terrific at teaching. Discussions were not mandatory. However, we did have checkoffs but you couldn't use a homework question - it was on lab questions only. Which wasn't a problem since labs were much easier.

I took the class last summer and it was not webcasted. Discussions were not mandatory, but you had to attend lab at least once a week because we had a check-off system. You'd have to explain your thought process behind a lab or homework question to a lab assistant to get checked off, and if you didn't you would get -1 point for the week. I do know people who had conflicts and made special arrangements with the instructor to get checked off at a time that worked for them. Not sure if the same system will continue this summer.

Hope that helps!

children.subject:
The policies for courses are part of the syllabus, which are usually released on the first day of class, or close to then.

Alternatively, you can wait for the instructors to be announced, and contact them then.
When would we find out what's mandatory and what's not? Just trying to make plans

history.content: Is CS61A over summer webcasted? And are discussions/labs mandatory, or can you do labs on your own?
history.subject: CS61A summer webcasted
